dt: used to say that an amount (of money) is a lot

dt.t: They made over a million dollars last year, and that {it}ain't hay{/it}!

shortdef: —used to say that an amount (of money) is a lot

meta.id: if it ain't broke, don't fix it
stems: if it ain't broke, don't fix it

hwi.hw: if it ain't broke, don't fix it

dt: used to say that one should not try to change something that is working well

shortdef: —used to say that one should not try to change something that is working well

meta.id: it ain't over until/till the fat lady sings
stems: it ain't over till the fat lady sings
it ain't over until the fat lady sings
it ain't over until/till the fat lady sings

hwi.hw: it ain't over until/till the fat lady sings

dt: used to say that the final result of something (such as a sports contest) has not yet been decided and could still change

dt.t: We're losing, but remember: {it}it ain't over till the fat lady sings{/it}.

shortdef: —used to say that the final result of something (such as a sports contest) has not yet been decided and could still change
